title: ineedhelpplease
author: ineedhelpplease
content: Hello, uh so I was wondering about the security of the wallet I am choosingRight now, I am using Exodus, which I heard here is a ticking time bomb. I am aware, and I responded saying that if I ever came across a sizable amount of money I would get a better wallet.Some irl stuff happened too don't wanna get into detail of that, unrelated to this thread but whatever. This will probably be my last threadSo, now that time has come. I quit this website since I have no use for it anymore, I am living a far more mentally healing life after a year and a half of pure struggling, LITERAL HELL and over 30-40 cases of bad luck and complete bs to say the least. I am fed up and now I am far away from the dumpster fire of the life I had, which you may see by just viewing my previous threads here, some of which was so bad I just had to edit it out/try to remove completely. $40-80 a week is nice but now I have alot more opportunities and I'm not struggling for the next half a year trying to earn "merit" to rank up. That was so annoying especially with all the unnecessary bs of people accusing me of being an alt and stuff. If I ever come back in the future hopefully no one tries some verification bs "account sold, account hacked!! respond with a signed message of ur wallet!!" because I will not ever.I need to find a good wallet without ordering anything to my house. I was thinking of Trezor/Ledger (I still need to be educated on the pros cons and differences about them), until I realized that I would have this sent to my house.Is there any other safe alternative option that doesn't involve this?

comments.author: Hatchy
comments.body: Sorry for how things turned out for you mate, going through your post history I saw that you have been through a lot. But just wanted to tell you that the Forum isn't responsible for any of your bad lucks. That's how life is sometimes so you have to deal with it.So for your question about wallet, I guess since you are so worried about exposing your location and keeping your privacy (I guess). Then you should try out some software wallet thats safe for long term and secured. I'll recommend electrum as I've also been using it for years to store some good amounts ands far no troubles. You can check out their website and download only from the links provided there.https://electrum.org/#home

comments.author: Despairo
comments.body: It's really depend on you.If you have a good understanding and technical skill in computer science, you can create your own air-gapped wallet using your own device, you can use Electrum https://electrum.readthedocs.io/en/latest/coldstorage.htmlIf you don't want to spend time to learn and no have any idea about it, just choose to buy the hardware wallet instead, you can use PO BOX, so it will not send directly to your address.

Everything I've had bad luck with was outside of this website. I actually learned alot about this site too and I'm grateful to even learn about this website. Also, there is always going to be people going through worse than what I went through. I tried to be "grateful" during the bad times but it's like really difficult especially at bad luck that seems to never end seemingly forever and ever til recently. I'm going to use my story and experience to try and help others when I am more prepared to. I actually do have a good reputation on another website non crypto related where I'm basically some "trusted" figure in their community for doing this type of stuff. I'm sorry for typing alot I just probably won't be using this website again anytime soon as soon as some random drama in the rep board is over, and I like to be happy during good times. The number 1 thing I always think about when I think about bitcointalk is all the people and friends I've met and came across over the years of my life who I will probably never speak to again sadly, due to the simple fact that I can't find them due to their inactivity, which is sad honestly.Quote from: Despairo on April 29, 2024, 08:21:12 AMIt's really depend on you.If you have a good understanding and technical skill in computer science, you can create your own air-gapped wallet using your own device, you can use Electrum https://electrum.readthedocs.io/en/latest/coldstorage.htmlIf you don't want to spend time to learn and no have any idea about it, just choose to buy the hardware wallet instead, you can use PO BOX, so it will not send directly to your address.As for both responses, I will check Electrum out right now, thank you I only know about a long majority of the history of this forum and some small things here and there that's about it. Maybe I will learn someday, but right now until my exams are over I will just be focusing strictly with school.

comments.body: Sad to hear about it dude. But to be honest the best wallet that is available other than the hardware wallet is the electrum wallet. I can also see that almost all the members are suggesting this also. This proves the popularity of the wallet and the security features it provides to its users. For this reason everyone considers it as best and I would also recommend this mate. If you can afford a hardware wallet then go for it, else Electrum also does the work perfectly.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Is this your latest topic? Or your last post? It seems that you are wasting a lot of emotions where you will not be heard. For what? Who is interested in your sob stories? You are on the Internet; never cry when those around you cannot understand you. If there are no such people nearby, then it is again only your fault. Be stronger, buy thick skin, and throw away the tear tissues. If you decide to leave, go away. Believe me, in this life, first of all, you only need yourself.And yes, the Electrum wallet is the best wallet for you. But "never say never." I think you understand what this phrase means?Also...close your threads to avoid spam after you leave.

comments.author: Alphakilo
comments.body: Sorry about your experience. Whatever you have gone through, you do not need to quit the site because of some accusation. You should stand strong. I can only imagine what you had to through those times. If you need a break you can take it but do not quit the forum just as you have asked your question and you are getting helpful replies, there will also be times when you will need the opinions, suggestions and answers of the forum members. In the end, the decision is up to you.

comments.author: promise444c5
comments.body: I think you've  been given all the information  to use inorder to get a tight security  for your coin especially using Electrum + your HD walletAlthough  it's  such a badluck experience  but all experience  either good or bad comes with a lesson and it will be better you learn from it .About the HD wallet you are considering  I think its  better  you go for Trezor  as Ledger have some accusations of not making  their wallet fully opensourced so they're pretty much having  some trust issues Trezor is fully open sourced.If you're  willing  to store only Bitcoin in your HD wallet , Trezor have the the Bitcoin-Only Firmware  which you could select  while initializing your new Trezor device  else you can just  go for the  universal firmware which supports some other tokens.If you feel like  switching in the future  you could go to your Settings > Device > Navigate to Firmware(you should  see the  Firmware you are currently using ,-Now you can try switching to your  desire Firmware  Either the Universal or the Vice-versa , the button is available You can check the link below to understand  betterhttps://trezor.io/learn/a/bitcoin-only-firmware-on-trezor
